intro: Stachys parvifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, violet-blue flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Stachys parvifolia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
